item.title: History
item.dc:creator: ehizzy
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image="6195" img_size="720x300"][vc_column_text]

HISTORICAL INFORMATION

Igbinedion University, Okada marks the realization of the dream of chief(Sir) Dr. Gabriel Osawaru Igbinedion, the Esama of Benin Kingdom, to bequeath to future generation of Nigeria University education of international standard where academic calendar is faithfully run without interruption.

The planning committee was inaugurated on 13THMarch 1995, comprising distinguished scholars and seasoned University administrators whose responsibilities amongst others included the formulation of the Academic Brief for the actualization of the Igbinedion University project.

The members of the committee were: Chief (Dr) Sir G. O. Igbinedion JP (Proprietor/Chairman), Late Pa S. I. Omorogbe , JP(Vice Chairman), Prof. T. M. Yesufu, Amb. (Dr.) A. I. Guobadia, Mr. Frank I. Imouokhome, Late Prof. P. N. Egharevba, Mr. Bright Igbinedion , A.O. Eghobamien Esq (SAN) (Member/Legal Adviser), Late Prince R. A. Williams JP (Member/Secretary).

The committees dedication to duty and resolute determination to provide a unique platform for higher education in Nigeria resulted in the presentation of certificate No. 01 dated 20th April 1999, to Chief Igbinedion on the 10th of May 1999. An implementation committee was immediately constituted on 12th May 1999 with the enlargement of the planning committee to include Prof. E. U. Emovon, FAS as the interim Vice Chancellor, Hon. Justice I.O. Aluyi, (Rtd), Mr. I. E. Edokpolor and Dr. T. B. E. Ogiamien, with Prince R. A. Williams as the Registrar. The Committee was dissolved with the inauguration of the Governing Council of the University on 14th October 1999 by the Proprietor and Chancellor. The Implementation Committee worked assiduously for six months as the Provisional Governing Council and Senate, guiding the physical and academic developments of the University. Prof. Bashir Ahmad Ikara was the Pro-Chancellor and Chairman of the Governing Council whose composition spanned the length and breadth of Nigeria and covered a variety of professions and interests. The members included: Prof. Bashir Ahmad Ikara- Pro-Chancellor & Chairman, Prof. E.U. Emovon, FAS- Vice Chancellor ad interim, Mr. Bright Igbinedion, Dr. B. J. E. Itsuele, Prof. A. U. Osagie, Dr. S. A. Ingawa, Prof. P.O. Erhabor, Prof. Olu Aina, Prof. G. C. Onyemelukwe, Prof. Mike Kwanashie, Engr. Festus Omo Evbuomwan, Hon. Justice (Rtd) I. O. Aluyi, Amb. (Dr.) Abel I. Guobadia (JP), Chief Eduwu Ekhator Obasogie (JP), Chief M. Okoya Thomas, Prof. Ikejiani-Clark, Prof. A. Akindoyemi, Prof. U. Joy Ogwu, Mr. R. A. Williams (JP) Registrar & Secretary.

Professor Anthony U. Osagie who was appointed Vice- Chancellor, served from 29th October 1999 to 30th November 2003, while Prince R. A. Williams remained the Registrar and Secretary to Council till 31th May, 2000. Thereafter, Mrs. O.T. Oni (Deputy Registrar) acted as the Registrar from 1st June 2000 to 28th November, 2001. Dr. (Mrs.) S. A. Asagwara assumed duty as the second substantive Registrar and Secretary Council on 29th November 2001. Dr. (Mrs.) Asagwara withdrew her service on 31th 2007. Mr. P. S. Nwaokolo served as the Acting Registrar from 1st August, 2007 to 5th May, 2009, on 6th May 2009, Mr. Edwin O. Okoro assumed duty as the third substantive Registrar. Dr. D. O. Olopade assumed duty as Bursar on 12th November 2001, while Mr. R. Olorunsola became the Ag. University Liberian on 22nd November 2002. Dr. (Mrs.) G.D. Ekpenyong served as University Liberian from 13th March, 2007 to 29th January 2009. Mr. Osas T. Evbayakha JP was appointed Bursar on 11th November 2007, while the University Liberian, Mr. Yakubu A. Izevbekhia assumed duty on 1st June, 2009. Mr. Nosa Edogiawerie was appointed Acting Bursar on 3rd September, 2010.

With the exit of Prof. Ikara in 2001, Response to a call for national service, Prof. Olu Aina, OFR, former Registrar and chief Executive of National Business and Technical Examinations Board (NABTEB), was appointed the Pro-Chancellor and Chairman of the Governing Council. Prof. Nduka Uraih served as Deputy Vice Chancellor from 2000-2003 and as Ag. Vice Chancellor from December 2003 to 11th September, 2004 following the expiration of the tenure of Prof. A. U. Osagie. In July 2004, the Council was reconstituted and Prof. Olu Aina OFR was re-appointed the Pro-Chancellor and Chairman of the current Governing Council to which Prof. Femi Odekunle was appointed a member on 13th September 2008.

On 13th September 2004, Professor Eghosa E. Osaghae of the University of Ibadan, assumed duty as the second substantive Vice Chancellor. He was re-appointed for a second term of five years on 13th September 2008 and re-appointed again on 8th July 2013 with effect from 13th September 2013. Professor Dennis E. Agbonlahor, Former Vice Chancellor of Ambrose Alli University, Ekpoma, was appointed administrative consultant to the University in September 2004, to help ease off the task of the Hon. Chancellor, a position he held until February 2006. On 12th September, 2005, Prof. L. C. Chiedozi was appointed the first Deputy Vice Chancellor. On expiration of his tenure Prof. (Mrs.) Tonye G. Okorie was appointed Deputy Vice Chancellor on 13th September 2008. On 1st October, 2013, Prof. Alexander B. Odiabo was appointed Deputy Vice Chancellor following the expiration of the tenure of Prof. (Mrs.) Tonye G. Okorie.

 

ACADEMIC HISTORY

The University commenced its academic programmes in the 1999/2000 session in five Colleges namely, Arts and Social Sciences, Business and Management Studies, Health Sciences, Law and Natural and Applied Sciences. The foundation students arrived Okada on Friday, 15th October 1999. Since then, the University has without interruption upheld its resolve to return tertiary education to the internationally accepted calendar of September to June. The College of Engineering commenced its programme in the 2002/2003 session. The College of Health Sciences continued to be an area of popular demand. The College of Pharmacy and B.Sc Nursing commenced in 2004/2005 session. The Igbinedion University Teaching Hospital administered by a Management Board inaugurated first on 12th January 2003, oversees the affairs of the Hospital. As part of its objectives to train and produce job providers, Igbinedion University has Packaged entrepreneurial and skills acquisitions modules to expose students sufficiently enough to be 'fit for the world of work'. In addition, a community service programme was introduced in the 2009/2010 session. Under the programmed, all second year students across the Colleges are required to undertake a practical development Programme in a chosen area and community in and round the university/town.

The student population has grown steadily from 111 in the 1999/2000 session to 5036 in 2012/2013, while the staff strength has increased from 55 in 1999/2000 to 565 made of 290 Teaching staff (50 of who are Professors) 153 Senior Non-Teaching staff and 213 Junior and Intermediate staff over the same period.

Academic programmes in Medicine, Law, Arts and Social Sciences, Business and Management Studies, Natural and Applied Sciences and Engineering which are mature, are re-accredited, from time to time by Nigerian Universities Commission and the relevant Professional bodies.

The Oba Erediauwa College of Law turned out its first crop of graduates in 2004. The eleventh batch graduating today is already at the Law School.

At this convocation, the University is graduating its eighth set of Medical Doctors, and has continued to maintain the distinction of being the first ever Private University in Africa , South of the Sahara to produce Medical Doctors. The University is also graduating her eighth crop of talented and well groomed Engineers from Gen. Abdulsalami Abubakar College of Engineering.

 

UNIVERSITY FOUNDATION DAY

Following the presentation of the Certificate to establish Igbinedion University to Chief (Dr.) Sir Gabriel Osawaru Igbinedion on 10th May 1999, the date 10th May has been adopted as the Universitys foundation day. Consequently, the maiden celebration was marked in may 2005,the second in May 2006, Third in May 2007, the forth in May 2008, the fifth in May 2009, the sixth in May 2010, the seventh in May 2011, the eighth in May 2012, the ninth in May 2013, the tenth in May 2014. The University celebrated its 10th milestone anniversary in May 2009.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: New IUO VC Assumes Office
item.dc:creator: dami
item.content:encoded: A new Vice Chancellor has assumed duty at the nations premier private university, the Igbinedion University, Okada, Edo State. He is professor Lawrence Ikechukwu Ezemonye. Prof Ezemonye took over from Prof Eghosa Osaghae who presided over the institution for fourteen years as Vice Chancellor. Prof Ezemonye is a renowned professor of Ecotoxicology and an Environmental Forensics in the department of Animal and Environmental Biology, with over thirty years of experience in research and teaching. He is currently a visiting professor to Lancaster University, UK, a pioneer Federal Director of the National Centre for Energy and Environment of the Energy Commission of Nigeria, National President of the Nigerian Environmental Society (NES), a distinguished Fellow of the Nigerian Environmental Society (FNES), Solar Energy Society of Nigeria (FSESN) and Advisor, West African Society of Toxicology (WASOT). The new VC has established university research linkages in Africa, Asia, Canada, UK and the US.

Stay informed and up to date with the latest breaking news on and off campus from athletic news to upcoming special events... | Read More[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space][vc_tabs interval="0" el_class="videoleft-textright"][vc_tab title="Our Mission" tab_id="1378873692534-0-9"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_single_image image="5920" img_size="339x300"][vc_column_text]

Vision

To be a leading centre of academic excellence through pro-active and responsive entrepreneurship, research in line with the dynamics of national and global development and knowledge production in response to contextualised national and global needs. [/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_single_image image="5921" img_size="339x300" css_animation="none"][vc_column_text]

Objectives

The objectives of the University are:To offer wide opportunities for higher education to all persons who can benefit from it, without distinction of race, religion, sex or political conviction/persuasion.

| Read more[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_single_image image="5923" img_size="339x300"][vc_column_text]

Mission

To provide overall service and good value for money in the University education sector. To be among the best and most successful universities in the country. | Read more[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tab][vc_tab title="IUO Pledge" tab_id="1378875435675-3-0"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="5944" img_size="520x378"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]

IUO Pledge

I am an Ambassador of Igbinedion University Okada. I pledge to regard myself, think, Speak and act faithfully At all times and in all places As a loyal Ambassador of the University. I pledge to be proud of my heritage As a product of Igbinedion University Okada And to always defend its honour and Glory I pledge to give due regard to: To its constituted authority. To be courteous and polite to All staff, students and alumni. To be obedient without being slavish; And to distinguish myself in all endeavors As an epitome of knowledge and Excellence All the days of my life. So help me God![/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tab][vc_tab title="Video" tab_id="1534571606457-6-8"][vc_column_text]

Together We Are Great!

[/vc_column_text][vc_video link="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xMhjrdtxBm8"][/vc_tab][vc_tab title="Administration" tab_id="1379454684035-5-10"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_column_text]

Vice Chancellor

Prof. L. I Ezemonye[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image="5936" img_size="520x378"][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_column_text]

Deputy VC

Prof. D. O Odejimi

The Registrar

Mr Edwin O. Okoro [/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_column_text]

Bursar

Mr. Nosa M

University Librarian

Mr. Yakubu A [/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tab][vc_tab title="Get Familiar" tab_id="1378873692002-0-10"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_gmaps link="#E-8_" size="371px" type="m" zoom="15" bubble="1"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]

Accomodation

Accommodation in University hostels is compulsory for every student.No student is allowed to live outside the hostels. Any student who does so will be expelled from the University.For further details, please refer to the Bursary for information on accomodation fees.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Fees

Search ourfee structureto find the fees for your course.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Transport Facility

The University provides a compulsory shuttle bus service to all studentsat a fee already included in the other charges.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Food

Food is available in cafeteria on "pay-as-you-eat" basis.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tab][vc_tab title="Colleges" tab_id="1378876827621-4-10"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="5946" img_size="520x378"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]

Colleges

COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SOCIAL SCIENCES

COLLEGE OF BUSINESS AND MANAGEMENT STUDIES

COLLEGE OF ENGINEERING

COLLEGE OF HEALTH SCIENCES

COLLEGE OF LAW

COLLEGE OF NATURAL AND APPLIED SCIENCES

COLLEGE OF PHARMACY

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tab][vc_tab title="Prospectus" tab_id="1379454237863-5-9"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="6476" img_size="400x400"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text]Click hereto download latest Prospectus[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tab][/vc_tabs][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_column_text]

IUO Computer Based Centre

[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image="6508" img_size="520x378" css_animation="slideInLeft"][vc_column_text]

The Igbinedion University Word Class IT Centre was donated by an alumnus of the university, Alhaji (Dr) Mushbahu, an international Business Mongul. The centre has the carrying capacity of 250 Students. It facilitates the university's computer based test (CBT).

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_column_text]

Our Achievements

[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image="6517" img_size="520x378" css_animation="zoomInDown"][vc_column_text]Igbinedion University, Okada (IUO), is the first University in Sub-Sahara Africa to establish tele-medicine and tele-conferencing facilities. These facilities have made the University unique, especially in the training of medical students in the allied medical programs. With the aid of the facility, students are able to link up with students in Howard University especially during surgery sessions.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_column_text]

Payment of Fees By Instalments

[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image="6514" img_size="520x378" css_animation="slideInRight"][vc_column_text]Following the harsh economic situation in the country, Igbinedion University allows payment of fees by instalments to make it easy for parents who desire quality education offered by the University so that all persons with such desire may enjoy quality training f their children in this university.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Colleges
item.dc:creator: ehizzy
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text][rev_slider alias="colg"][/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text]

ONE UNIVERSITY, SEVEN COLLEGES

Igbinedion University runs a collegial system; that is, the university in place of faculties has colleges. The following colleges are available (click any of the colleges for more detail):[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text]

COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SOCIAL SCIENCES

COLLEGE OF BUSINESS AND MANAGEMENT STUDIES

COLLEGE OF ENGINEERING

COLLEGE OF HEALTH SCIENCES

COLLEGE OF LAW

COLLEGE OF NATURAL AND APPLIED SCIENCES

COLLEGE OF PHARMACY

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column][/vc_column][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SOCIAL SCIENCES
item.dc:creator: ehizzy
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space][vc_custom_heading text="COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SOCIAL SCIENCES" font_container="tag:h2|text_align:center"][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text][rev_slider alias="art"][/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SOCIAL SCIENCESis one of the pioneer colleges established at the inception of Igbinedion University. This college has the highest number of programmes/departments.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]Departments and academic programmes in the COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SOCIAL SCIENCES:
  • ECONOMICS & DEVELOPMENT STUDIES-B.Sc.
  • ENGLISH-B.A.
  • GEOGRAPHY AND REGIONAL PLANNING-B.Sc.
  • INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS & STRATEGIC STUDIES-B.Sc.
  • MASS COMMUNICATION-B.Sc.
  • POLITICAL SCIENCE & PUBLIC ADMINISTRATION-B.Sc.
  • SOCIOLOGY & ANTHROPOLOGY-B.Sc.
  • THEATRE ARTS-B.A.
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: COLLEGE OF BUSINESS AND MANAGEMENT STUDIES
item.dc:creator: ehizzy
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space][vc_custom_heading text="COLLEGE OF BUSINESS AND MANAGEMENT STUDIES" font_container="tag:h2|text_align:center"][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text][rev_slider alias="bus"][/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]This College is named after the former Central Bank Governor and now the Emir of Knao, Mallam Sanusi Lamido Sanusi. Many of our students pass the ICAN examination, therefore qualifying to become Chattered Accountants while studying at the university and many others shortly after graduation.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]Departments and academic programmes in the COLLEGE OF BUSINESS AND MANAGEMENT STUDIES:
  • ACCOUNTING - B.Sc., M.Sc., PHD
  • BANKING AND FINANCE -B.Sc., M.Sc., PHD
  • BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION - B.Sc
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: COLLEGE OF ENGINEERING
item.dc:creator: ehizzy
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space][vc_custom_heading text="COLLEGE OF ENGINEERING" font_container="tag:h2|text_align:center"][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text][rev_slider alias="engr"][/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]The College qualified the first set of students in 2005, and at the moment, a good number of the graduates have finished their P.hDs in foreign universities. It is worthy to note that students of Petroleum Engineering in 2015 and 2016 qualified to represent Nigeria in Petro Bow competition organised for students studying Petroleum Engineering in tertiary institutions in Africa and beyond. For two consecutive years, that is, in 2015 and 2016, Nigeria Society of Petroleum Engineers funded the trips of Igbinedion University students to Texas, USA and Dubai for Petro Bow Competition respectively. In various ways, Igbinedion University has made some marks of distinction in the training of Petroleum Engineers. We can boast to say that we train the best Petroleum engineers in the Country.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]Departments and academic programmes in the COLLEGE OF ENGINEERING:
  • CHEMICAL ENGINEERING-B.Eng.
  • CIVIL ENGINEERING-B.Eng.
  • COMPUTER ENGINEERING-B.Eng.
  • ELECTRICAL/ELECTRONICS ENGINEERING-B.Eng.
  • MECHANICAL ENGINEERING-B.Eng.
  • PETROLEUM ENGINEERING-B.Eng.
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: COLLEGE OF HEALTH SCIENCES
item.dc:creator: ehizzy
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space][vc_custom_heading text="COLLEGE OF HEALTH SCIENCES" font_container="tag:h2|text_align:center"][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text][rev_slider alias="hth"][/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]This College is headed by the Provost and it is also divided into two schools, namely, School of Basic Medical Sciences and School of Clinical Medicine. Each of the schools is headed by a Dean.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]Departments and academic programmes in the COLLEGE OF HEALTH SCIENCES:
  • ANATOMY-B.Sc.
  • BASIC MEDICAL SCIENCE-B.A.
  • BIOCHEMISTRY-B.Sc.
  • MEDICAL LABORATORY SCIENCE-B.Sc.
  • NURSING SCIENCE-B.Sc.
  • PHYSIOLOGY-B.Sc.
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: COLLEGE OF LAW
item.dc:creator: ehizzy
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space][vc_custom_heading text="COLLEGE OF LAW" font_container="tag:h2|text_align:center"][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text][rev_slider alias="law"][/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]This is a one-programme College. The College is headed by a Dean. Graduates of the College after five years of studies are offered LLB as applicable in other universities. The College has produced well over twenty PhDs in the past seven years. Graduates of the college are making waves in legal practices as well as in academics with 2 first class graduates also making first class in Nigeria Bar Exams.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]Departments and academic programmes in the COLLEGE OF LAW:
  • LAW - LLB, LLM, M-Phil/PHD, PHD
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: COLLEGE OF NATURAL AND APPLIED SCIENCES
item.dc:creator: ehizzy
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space][vc_custom_heading text="COLLEGE OF NATURAL AND APPLIED SCIENCES" font_container="tag:h2|text_align:center"][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text][rev_slider alias="sci"][/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]This is also one of the foundation colleges of the University since 1999.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]Departments and academic programmes in the COLLEGE OFNATURAL AND APPLIED SCIENCES:
  • CHEMISTRY-B.Sc.
  • COMPUTER SCIENCE-B.Sc.
  • MICROBIOLOGY-B.Sc.
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: COLLEGE OF PHARMACY
item.dc:creator: ehizzy
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space][vc_custom_heading text="COLLEGE OF PHARMACY" font_container="tag:h2|text_align:center"][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text][rev_slider alias="pharm"][/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]This is another single programme College. Igbinedion University's Pharmacy are offered B.Pharm at the end of their training. The College in 2017 graduated its 6th set of trained pharmacists. The College is named after the former vibrant Director-General of NAFDAC and Minister of Information during the Presidents Obasanjo and Yar'Adua regimes respectively.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]Departments and academic programmes in the COLLEGE OF PHARMACY:
  • PHARMACY - B-Pharm
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Admission Instructions
item.dc:creator: ehizzy
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space][vc_custom_heading text="Admissions" font_container="tag:h2|text_align:center"][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text]

After reading and understanding the admission criteria detailed below, proceed to our main admission portal

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height="16px"][vc_btn title="Click here to apply" color="danger" link="url:https%3A%2F%2Fwww.iuokada.edu.ng%2Fonline-application%2F|||"][vc_empty_space height="16px"][vc_column_text]We are pleased to invite applications for first year and direct entry admissions to undergraduate programmes from purpose-driven and ambitious candidates, parents and sponsors. HOW? If you desire to actualize your creative genius, to become a National and Global Leader, to learn in a serene, secular, diverse and focused environment under the tutelage of some of thebrightest and best lecturers and mentors; have 5 O' Level credits, or A' Level papers, approved Diploma or first degree. For Direct Entry admission, you need to register for JAMB
THEN APPLY NOW FOR ADMISSION INTO FIRST DEGREE PROGRAMMES IN THE FOLLOWING COLLEGES
 
  • ARTS AND SOCIAL SCIENCES(Economics & Development Studies, English, Geography & Regional Planning, Mass Communication, Political Science & Public Administration, International Relations, Sociology & Anthropology, Theatre Arts)
  • SANUSI LAMIDO SANUSI COLLEGE OF BUSINESS AND MANAGEMENT STUDIES(Accounting, Banking & Finance, Business Administration)
  • OBA EREDUAUWA COLLEGE OF LAW(Bachelor of Law, LL.B)
  • GENERAL ABDULSALAMI ABUBAKAR COLLEGE OF ENGINEERING(Civil, Chemical, Computer, Electrical/Electronics, Mechanical, Petroleum Engineering)
  • OBA OKUNADE SIJUWADE COLLEGE OF HEALTH SCIENCES(Medicine & Surgery, Anatomy, Biochemistry, Physiology, Medical Laboratory Sciences, Nursing Science)
  • COLLEGE OF NATURAL AND APPLIED SCIENCES(Chemistry & Industrial Chemistry, Computer Science & Information Technology, Microbiology)
  • DORA AKUNYILI COLLEGE OF PHARMACY(Pharmacy)
 

General Entry Requirements

  • To be eligible for admission into the four-year disciplines and five or six-year professional programmes, candidates must possess a minimum of five credits at the GCE/WAEC, SSCE/NECO, or SSCE/NABTEB certificate examinations, which must include English Language and Mathematics at not more than two sittings. In addition, candidates seeking admission into Law must possess at least a credit pass in Literature in English. Candidates awaiting GCE/NECO SSCE/WAEC SSCE/NABTEB results are also encouraged to apply provided the results would be available by September, when the new session commences.
  • Candidates may also seek admission into the 200 level of the degree programmes with the following qualifications:
  1. Passes in at least two subjects at the Advanced level and an additional subject at the subsidiary level in the General Certificate of Education Examination.The subjects must constitute a suitable preliminary to the intended courses.
  2. Diploma/NCE at credit level pass and above in the appropriate subjects from a recognized institution.
  3. IJMB in the appropriate subjects.
  4. First Degree in relevant discipline.
  5. In all these cases, candidates must also satisfy the requirements for matriculation viz: five credit passes at the GCE/WAEC SSCE/NECO SSCE/NABTEB Certificate examinations.
Candidates are required to show evidence of application to JAMB

UTME Requirement

Candidates applying for admission are required to sit forUTMEand obtain the prescribed cut-off marks. This is a statutory requirement for entry into Nigerian universities

Transfer Students

In addition, for students seeking transfer from another institution of higher degree of learning to Igbinedion University, Okada, an official copy of Academic Transcript is required.

Age

Candidates who areabove 22 yearsof age will not be deemed eligible for admission. Older candidates may be admitted underexceptional circumstances.

How to Apply

Prospective Students must possess the required WASC/GCE/NECO credits (Advanced level passes/first degrees for direct entry), be registered with JAMB, and pass the UTME. More about our online application instructions is available on ouronline application portal

Accommodation

Accommodation is provided for all STUDENTS at the Okada Wonderland Estate.

Fees and Finances

IUO charges moderate and affordable fees. For details on payment of fees and other financial regulations,please click here

Scholarships

In line with our foundation principles of providing unequalled opportunity for learning and promotion of knowledge, Igbinedion University Okada offers generous scholarships towards the development of scientific research and studies in the humanities in the following disciplines: Banking and Finance, Chemical Science, Microbiology, Sociology, Political Science, Theatre Arts, English, Geography & Regional Planning, Business Administration, Biochemistry, Physiology, and Anatomy. The scholarships are offered on merit and first-come-first served basis.

Post-UTME Screening Date and Centres

Upon completion of your admission form online, you will choose your preferred screening centre. Your screening date will also be provided on your acknowledgement slip upon completion of the admission process. Candidates who chose Igbinedion University, Okada as their first and second choice JAMB (UMTE) should also attend the screening exercise.

After reading and understanding the admission criteria detailed above, you may now proceed to our main admission portal

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height="16px"][vc_btn title="Click here to apply" color="danger" link="url:https%3A%2F%2Fwww.iuokada.edu.ng%2Fonline-application%2F|||"][vc_column_text]Igbinedion University, Okada, Your key to a Successful Future.For more information, contact: Dean of Student Affairs : 08055163397, Admissions Officer : 07032924219, PRO : 08037937287 Mr. Edwin O. Okoro Registrar[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

  1. Pay the transcript processing fee. The fee paid for transcript processing depends on the destination where the transcript is to be delivered to, as well as the academic level, as described below:

International Destination Address: N50,000 ($150)

Undergraduate transcript (for graduates)

Local destination address: N12,500 ($38)

International destination address: N25,000 ($75)

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]2. Payment details for transcript processing fee is as stated below:

Bank Name: Zenith Bank

Account Name: ABC Microfinance Bank

Account Number: 1013139941

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Please note that transcripts are processed after confirming payment of transcript processing fee. Please forward further enquires or complaints to any of the following contacts: +234 803 548 6461 OR +234 803 083 8685[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_btn title="Click Here To Start Your Transcript Application" color="primary" link="url:https%3A%2F%2Fwww.iuokada.edu.ng%2Fonline-application%2F|||"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Fee Structure
item.dc:creator: ehizzy
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space][vc_empty_space][vc_custom_heading text="Guidelines for Payment of Fees"][vc_empty_space][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text][table id=3responsive=scroll /][/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text][table id=4 responsive=scroll /][/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text][table id=5 responsive=scroll /][/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text][table id=11 responsive=scroll /][/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text][table id=12 responsive=scroll /][/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text]NOTE:
  1. All fees are paid through e-tranzact platform at Access Bank, Zenith Bank,First bank, orKeystone bank
  2. Direct Entry (DE) Students are to continue paying the same fee as andwhen admitted
[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text][table id=13 responsive=scroll /][/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text]NOTE:
  1. Additional Feesis not the same asOther Charges. They are ADDITIONAL FEES
  2. Fees paid are not refundable or transferable after payment
  3. Access Bank Hostel is for female students who are in 200 Level and above
  4. Forging of e-tranzact slip attracts a fine of N50,000
  5. Payment details forADDITIONAL FEES:
[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text]a. Items 1-11 on the Additional Fees table above should be paid to any of the accounts below: [table id=14 responsive=scroll /][/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text]b. For items number 12, 13, and 14, see payment details below: [table id=15 responsive=scroll /][/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text]NOTE: Formore details, please call: Bursar - 08034695023, Registrar - 08033958334[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text]

FEE PAYMENT PROCEDURE

The University has provided twopayments options. Option 1: Pay Directly at the Bank with Your Unique Number With this option, you simply walk into the bankand provide the bank teller (i.e. cashier) with your Unique number. For new students, your Unique Number is theAdmission Number(indicated below your name on your admission letter). For returning students, your Unique number is yourMatriculation Number. (Note: For yourUnique Number,the cashier may ask for yourApplication Numberinstead of yourAdmission Number.Be informed that yourAdmission Numbersupersedes yourApplication Numberand thusAdmission Numbershould be used for all fees that you wish to pay using thisUnique Number payment option) Upon verification of your Unique Number, the teller processes your transaction. Option 2: Pay Directly Online with Your Bank Account This is an online payment option. Therefore, you do not need to go to the bank to make your payment. For this option, follow the steps below(note that Unique Number for new students is Admission Number, while for returning students, it is Matriculation Number):
  1. Login tohttp://iuokada.edu.ng/portal/students
  2. Login with your unique number. Password is: 2016
  3. Click on "Make payment"
  4. Select the session you are paying for from the list of sessions provided
  5. Type the amount you want to pay
  6. Select the option: "Pay directly online with your Bank Account"
  7. Click "Proceed"
  8. Select your bank from the list of banks provided
Follow the instructions thereafter to pay directly online with your Bank Account Number. Please note that you can pay your school feesininstalments, for up tothree times.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: ehizzy
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_single_image image="6207" img_size="720x300"][vc_column_text]

VISION

To be a leading centre of academic excellence through pro-active and responsive entrepreneurship, research in line with the dynamics of national and global development and knowledge production in response to contextualized national and global needs  

OBJECTIVES

The objectives of the University are:

  • To train qualified personnel imbued with the spirit of service and development.
  • To offer wide opportunities for higher education to all persons who can benefit from it, without distinction of race, religion, sex or political conviction/persuasion.
  • To train scientists, engineers, doctors, teachers, economists, lawyers, including specialist in the field of humanities and to conduct research in science and technology.
  • To carry out research on problems relating to the development of the national economy scheme and technology and culture as well as to advance knowledge.
  • To train teachers and academic research staff for the University and other higher educational institutions.
  • To promote scientific knowledge and disseminate its results for socio-economic benefits.
  • To undertake any other activities appropriate for a University of the highest standard.
 

MISSION

Our Mission is to:
  • To be among the best and most successful universities in the country.
  • To provide overall service and good value for money in the University education sector.
  • To excel in anticipating, responding quickly and competitively to students needs and staff development.
  • To maintain a growth that responds to overall global expansion and challenges in teaching and research.
  • To produce through our quality programmes, University graduates whose certificates open all doors to upward economic and social mobility.
  • To expand our research activities globally by creating linkages and collaboration networks amongst leading universities and research institutions world-wide.
  • To regularly seek to maintain the acquisition of knowledge and excellence.
  • To operate competency driven scheme, which allows staff to acquire new skills, knowledge base and remain competitive in their areas of specialization.
  • To regularly survey the environment in order to identify areas of need with a view to contributing to the community and registering significant presence nationally and world-wide.
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: VICE CHANCELLOR'S MESSAGE
item.dc:creator: ehizzy
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space][vc_empty_space][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_empty_space][vc_column_text]Dear Parents/Prospective students Greetings from Igbinedion University, Okada Igbinedion University is Nigerias Premier Private university situated in Okada Wonderland, Edo State Nigeria. It was established on 10th May 1989. The University has sevenCollegesand several programmes as can be seen in this website which gives an insight into the University. We run un-interrupted Academic Sessions wherein students graduate at the stipulated time. All our programmes are accredited by the relevant regulatory and professional bodies such as National Universities Commission (NUC), Medical and Dental Council of Nigeria (MDCN), Pharmacists Council of Nigeria (PCN), Medical Laboratory Science Council of Nigeria (MLSCN), Council of Legal Education (CLE), Nursing and Midwifery Council of Nigeria (NMCN), Council for the Regulation of Engineering in Nigeria (COREN), Computer Professionals Registration Council of Nigeria (CPN), Institute of Chattered Accountants of Nigeria (ICAN), etc. The University has state-of -the-Arts facilities ranging from Hostels, Lecture Halls, Laboratories, Sporting facilities and a serene environment for learning. Students have the opportunity of benefitting from the competitive scholarships attached to some programme/courses. The schoolfeesare affordable and can be paid in instalments. Our testimonial speaks for itself, as we have produced graduates who are blazing the trials of their chosen careers from disciplines such as, but not limited to Medicine, Law, Engineering, Pharmacy, Computer Science, Accounting & Information Technology. It is my pleasure to invite you to Igbinedion University and experience this new world of unlimited opportunities and get trained in character, learning and entrepreneurial skills. Thank you. Prof.Lawrence I. Ezemonye, PHD, FNES, FSESN Vice Chancellor[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Postgraduate Admissions
item.dc:creator: dami
item.content:encoded:
IGBINEDION UNIVERSITY OKADA, EDO STATE, NIGERIA SCHOOL OF POSTGRADUATE STUDIES AND RESEARCH ADVERTISEMENT FOR 2018/19 POSTGRADUATE ADMISSION

The School of Postgraduate Studies and Research, Igbinedion University Okada offer admission for the following Programs in our Colleges for 2018/2019 Academic Session.  
PROCEED TO ONLINE REGISTRATION PAGE
Contact numbers: Dean PG School: 08034701511 Sec, PG School: 07032511003 Sub-Dean, Arts and Humanities: 08063170869 Sub-Dean, Science and Technology: 08037511008 Sub-Dean, CASS: 08038741315 Sub-Dean, College of Law: 0802359991 Sub-Dean, CBMS: 07035392472  

COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SOCIAL SCIENCES

Programme:
  1. Economics and Developmental Studies
  2. International Relations and Strategic Studies
  3. Mass Communication
  4. Political Science and Public Administration
Areas of Specialization
  1. Economics and Developmental Studies
  • Monetary Economics
  • International Economics
  • Public Sector Economics
  1. International Relations and Strategic Studies
  • International Relations
  • Strategic Studies
  • Diplomatic Studies
  1. Mass Communication
  • Print Journalism
  • Broadcast Journalism
  • Advertising
  • Public Relations
  1. Political Science and Public Administration
  • Political Sociology
  • Political Theory
  • Comparative Politics and Development Studies
  • Public Policy
  • Management of Public Sector Organization
  • Management of Public Enterprises
  • Comparative and Public Administration
Admission Requirements:
  1. POST GRADUATE DIPLOMA (PGD)
  • Candidates must have 5 credit Passes including English Language and Mathematics at O Level.
  • Candidates should have not less than 3rd Class Honour Bachelors Degree from an approved Universities in the course of study or related discipline
  • Candidates with HND and or Professional qualifications cognate to their study or related discipline from a recognized Institution with not less than Upper Credit are also eligible.
 
  1. MSc Programme
Programme: 1. Economics and Development Studies
  1. International Relation and Strategic Studies
  2. Mass Communication
  3. Political Science and Public Administration
Admission Requirements:
  • Candidates must satisfy the matriculation requirements of the University including English Language and Mathematics.
  • Candidates with Bachelors degree in their course of study from an approved University whose programme have been accredited by the NUC
  • Candidates with a minimum of Second Class Lower Degree and a CGPA of 3.00 on a five point scale are eligible.
  • Candidates with a Postgraduate Diploma (PGD) Degree from their course of study or a cognate discipline awarded by Igbinedion University, Okada or other recognized Institution with not less than an upper Credit.
  1. PhD Programme
Programme:
  1. Economics and Development Studies
  2. International Relation and Strategic Studies
  3. Mass Communication
  4. Political Science and Public Administration
Admission Requirements:
  • University minimum requirements for a BSc degree in the field of Study
  • BSc degree from an approval University whose programme is accredited by the NUC
  • A minimum of a second class lower degree in the field of study
  • MSc degree in the field of study with a CGPA of at least 4.0 in a 5 point scale
  • Submission of a brief satisfactory statement of intended are of research.
  COLLEGE OF BUSINESS AND MANAGEMENT STUDIES Programme:
  1. Accounting
  2. Business Management
  3. Banking and Finance
Areas of Specialization
  • Accounting
  • Banking and Finance
  • Management Information System
  • Human Resources Management
  • Marketing
  1. POST GRADUATE DIPLOMA (PGD)
Admission Requirements: Provided the matriculation requirements are satisfied;
  • Five credit passes including English Language and Mathematics at the O level.
  • Relevant Bachelors Degree not lower than Third Class Division from recognized Universities.
  • Bachelors Degrees with at least Second Class Lower Division in areas not related to Administration may be considered.
  • Higher National Diploma at least upper credit level.
  • Relevant Professional qualifications.
  1. MSc Program.
Admission Requirements: Provided the Universitys matriculation requirements are satisfied;
  • Degree in relevant area from a recognized University with minimum of second Class Lower Division may be admitted provided the University Matriculation requirements are satisfied.
  • A postgraduate diploma at upper credit level in relevant area from a recognized university
  1. PhD Program.
  • Admission Requirements
A good MSc degree in the relevant area with at least an average of B grade (60%) which includes course work and thesis/dissertation.
  1. Master of Business Administration (MBA) (Academic)
Admission Requirements:
  • Basic Admission Requirements
The criteria for admission into the MBA programme will be as follows:
  • All candidates must have credit passes including English Language and Mathematics at the O level as basic requirement.
  • Candidates with Bachelors degree from an approved university must obtain a minimum of second class lower division.
  • All candidates must have minimum of one year managerial/administrative experience.
  • All candidates must have demonstrated adequate intellectual capacity, professionalism, maturity and effective decision making and problem solving potentials during the universitys admission test and interview.
  • All candidates must have attained a satisfactory level of performance in the universitys admission test and interview.
  • Candidates with postgraduate diploma from a recognized university and who have passed with a minimum of upper credit may also be considered for admission provided the universitys matriculation requirements are satisfied.
  • Candidates with good quantitative background and some basic knowledge of economics will have added advantage.
  • Holders of HND and/or professional qualification in administration disciplines are eligible for admission but must go through a mandatory nine months postgraduate diploma in the University provided they meet the basic University entry qualifications.
COLLEGE OF NATURAL APPLIED SCIENCES Programme:
  1. MICROBIOLOGY
Areas of Specialization:
  • Environmental and Public Health Microbiology
  • Food and Industrial Microbiology
  • Brewing Science
  • Plant Pathogenic Microbiology
  • Animal Pathogenic Microbiology (Medical Microbiology)
  • Immunology and Immunochemistry
  • Microbial Physiology and Biochemistry
  • Pollution Studies
  1. Programmes:
  • Post Graduate Diploma (PGD)
  • MSc
  • PhD
Admission Requirements; A candidate shall normally have at least Second Class Honours (upper/lower) degree in Microbiology or other related fields of study (e.g Biochemistry, Botany, Zoology, Crop Protection) of the Igbinedion University, or any other University of recognized standard. Other candidates whose qualifications and experience are deemed adequate and satisfactory may also be considered for admission. In the latter, a qualified examination may be required.
  1. COLLEGE OF LAW
Programs: LAW Areas of Specialization:
  1. International Law
  2. Public Law
  3. Business Law
  4. Private and Property Law
  5. Jurisprudence
  1. Masters of Law (LL.M)
Admission Requirements The criteria for admission into the LL.M programme are as follows:
  • A Bachelor of Laws degree from an approved University with a minimum of Second Class Honours Lower Division.
  • A minimum of five (5) credit passes, including English Language and Literature in English, at not more than two (2) sittings in SSC/GCE ordinary Level or its equivalent.
  • A minimum of two positive references as to character and learning must to be submitted by the applicant. At least one of the references must be obtained from the applicants former lecturers in the Faculty of Law.
A University may, in addition, conduct a qualifying examination for applicants for the purpose of admission.
  1. Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D) Degree
The criteria for admission into the Doctor of Philosophy Programme in Law are as follows:
  • A Master of Philosophy (M.Phil) degree from an approved University.
  • A Master of Laws (LL.M) degree from an approved University with research thesis and a weighted course work average which shall normally be not less than 60% OR
  • A Masters of Law (LL.M) degree by course work from an approved University with an average which should normally be not less than 60%.
Applicants for M.Phil and Ph.D degree programmes must also satisfy the requirements under section 2, 3, 1 (ii) and (iii) above. A University may, in addition, conduct a qualifying examination for applicants for the purpose of admission into M.Phil/Ph.D degree programmes.
  1. Specialised Masters Programmes
Specialised Masters programmes may be run by a university in special areas of the Law for public officers legal practitioners and other professionals who need law to enable them perform efficiently in their vocations. Such specialized programmes shall be for a minimum of twelve (12) calendar months.
  1. Part time Programmes
LL.M, M.Phil and Ph.D degrees may be offered on part-time basis. The duration shall be:
  • For the LL.M, a minimum of 2 years and a maximum of 4 years:
  • For the M.phil, a minimum of 3 years and a maximum of 5 years and
  • For the Ph.D, a minimum of 4 years and a maximum of 7 years. The Postgraduate School Board may, upon reasonable ground, grant extension to a student.
 
PROCEED TO ONLINE REGISTRATION PAGE
  Phone Numbers to call: 07032511003,08034701511, 08065100673 and 08063170869

item.title: IUO-Law programme accreditation
item.dc:creator: dami
item.content:encoded:
This is to notify the general public that the Law program of Igbinedion University is fully accredited by the National Universities Commission (NUC) for the next five years the body with the statutory mandate to accredit academic programmes in Nigerian Universities. In a response to the accreditation visit to the University in June, 2018, NUC approved full accreditation status of our Law degree programme in an NUC letter with reference number NUC/ES/412/VOL.12/5 and dated 14th August 2018.

Click here for full report of the Law accreditation Exercise

item.title: IGBINEDION UNIVERSITY OKADA HAS A NEW VICE-CHANCELLOR
item.dc:creator: ehizzy
item.content:encoded:
IGBINEDION UNIVERSITY OKADA HAS A NEW VICE-CHANCELLOR He is PROFESSOR LAWRENCE IKECHUKWU EZEMONYE, FNES, FSESN
  • Professor of Ecotoxicology & Environmental Forensics
  • Former Deputy Vice-Chancellor (Administration) UNIBEN
  • Visiting Professor, Lancaster University, UK
  • National President, Nigerian Environmental Society
Prof. Lawrence Ikechukwu Ezemonye is a renowned Professor of Ecotoxicology and Environmental Forensics in the Department of Animal and Environmental Biology, University of Benin, Nigeria, with over 30 years experience in research and teaching. A Visiting Professor to Lancaster University, UK, who has served as Deputy Vice-Chancellor (Administration), at the University of Benin; a pioneer Federal Director of the National Centre for Energy and Environment of the Energy Commission of Nigeria; National President of the Nigerian Environmental Society (NES), a distinguished Fellow of the Nigerian Environmental Society (FNES), Solar Energy Society of Nigeria (FSESN), and Advisor, West African Society of Toxicology (WASOT). Prof Ezemonye has established university research linkages in Africa, Asia, Canada, United Kingdom and USA. Prof. Ezemonye is currently one of the Nigerian representatives on World Energy Council (WEC), UK study team on Energy Resources and Policy Assessment. Prof. Ezemonye is married to Professor (Mrs.) Mary Nkiru Ezemonye and blessed with four children. Signed. Edwin o. Okoro. Registrar

item.title: VC Receives IUO Alumni Exco in His Office
item.dc:creator: dami
item.content:encoded:
[rev_slider alias="Exco Visit VC"] The Vice-Chancellor, Prof. Lawrence Ezemonye has received a delegation of the Alumni Association of Igbinedion University Okada in his office.
The leadership of the Alumni body was on a courtesy visit to the immediate Vice-Chancellor of the existence, structure and challenges being faced by the body which was inaugurated in 2014.
Members of the Alumni Executive that attended the meeting are Mr. Charles Akarola (President), Hon. Uzochukwu Kelvin (Vice-President), Godfrey Williams-Chukwu (Member), and Mr. Daniel Igbinedion (Alumni Relations Officer).
In his address to the Vice-Chancellor, the President of the association, Mr. Charles Akarola expressed the desire of members of the Forum to make contributions as a way of giving back to their alma-mata. He noted that many products of the University are excelling in various fields around the globe and that it is only appropriate for them to give back to the system that gave them the platform to be a graduate.
Mr. Akarola however expressed regrets that the environment of the school is no longer as it used to be. He complained about the environment and the hostel facilities as one area of great concern to the Forum.
He also dwelled on the difficulty of processing transcript by graduates of the University, a situation that has made many people forfeit admissions, loose monies and denied opportunity. He observed that this maybe on of the critical factor that is making IUO alumni not to be excited about the school. He said Alumni are indeed unhappy with their school.
Mr. Akarola further raised the issue of Alumni levy noting that it is high time that the school relinquish the fund regenerated for Alumni Dues to the Alumni Association for the Association so that the Association can use such fund to the Alumni as seed fund to raise bigger capital for meaningful projects.
Responding, The Vice-Chancellor emphasized the importance of Alumni Association to the continued survival of any Institution. He cited an example of the University of Benin where Alumnis have chapters up to facility level and has grown so powerful to the point that it determines who emerges as Deans, DVC, and HODs in the University. He therefore encouraged the Executives not to rest on their oars but assured them of prompt support and attention at all times.
The Vice-Chancellor also responded to the issue of funds stating that while the management will look into the issue of alumni dues, it is pertinent to note that external sourcing of funds is the way to go. He suggested zonal reunion programs for the association. He even suggested UK reunion, USA reunion etc.
On the issue of environment, the VC assures the executives that the environment is the key to his agenda and that in not far distant time, the environment and hostel will a facelift

item.title: New IUO VC Assumes Office
item.dc:creator: dami
item.content:encoded: A new Vice Chancellor has assumed duty at the nations premier private university, the Igbinedion University, Okada, Edo State.Prof Lawrence Ikechukwu Ezemonye took over from Prof Eghosa Osaghae who presided over the institution for fourteen years as Vice Chancellor. Prof Ezemonye is a renowned professor of Ecotoxicology and an Environmental Forensics in the department of Animal and Environmental Biology, with over thirty years of experience in research and teaching. He is currently a visiting professor to Lancaster University, UK, a pioneer Federal Director of the National Centre for Energy and Environment of the Energy Commission of Nigeria, National President of the Nigerian Environmental Society (NES), a distinguished Fellow of the Nigerian Environmental Society (FNES), Solar Energy Society of Nigeria (FSESN) and Advisor, West African Society of Toxicology (WASOT). The new VC has established university research linkages in Africa, Asia, Canada, UK and the US. Highlights Courtesy visit by Alumni Exco VC tours Benin center Courtesy visit by bank managers Courtesy visit from various units Courtesy visit by Huwawei Courtesy visit by Aphrikulture

item.title: Courtesy Visit by Bank Managers
item.dc:creator: dami
item.content:encoded:
[rev_slider alias="Courtesy Visit by Bank Managers"] The Vice Chancellor recently played host to the bank mangers of all the Banks in the community who came on a courtesy visit to the new Vice-Chancellor.
The managers include Mr. Anthony Egbochonye of the ABC Microfinance bank, Mr. Monday Osimeh of the Zenith Bank Plc, Mr. Kennedy Akpengbe of Access Bank Plc also accompanied by the Head of Operations of the Branch, Miss Kessiena Okoro, Mr. Nosa Ehiorobo of the Sterling Bank.
Also in attendance at the meeting were members of the University Management, including the University Bursar, Mr. Nosa Edogiawerie, Registrar, Mr. Edwin Okoro, Deputy Vice-Chancellor Dr. (Mrs.) Deborah Odejimi.
In his address to the Bank Managers, the Vice-Chancellor admonished them to be more responsive to the Universitys needs and reciprocate the patronage of the University, its Staff and Students by offering better and qualitative service. The Vice - Chancellor laments the shortage of ATM facilities for students and staff particularly at the Crown Estate Campus.
He therefore enjoined the Bank managers to consider setting up ATM gallery with WIFI and sitting arena for students relaxation on Campus. He observed that it will not be too much a sacrifice to make by the Banks.
Earlier, the Bank Managers respectively made self-introduction of the services their bank renders to the University and also stated the challenges they face during their operation.

item.title: Courtesy Visits from Various Units
item.dc:creator: dami
item.content:encoded:
[rev_slider alias="Visit From Various Units"]
Several Units of the University Community paid courtesy visit to the Vice-Chancellor in the month of July 2018
The first teams were the Board and Management of Igbinedion University Staff School. The team was led by Prof. (Mrs.) Tonye Okorie who is the Chairman of the IUSS Board, other members of the team include Dr. R.E Nwokedi (Board member), Mrs. Igbinosa Deputy Registrar (Academics), Mr. Taiwo Fadeji of the Bursary Department (member), Mr. Ogungbele Akeem, (Secondary School) Mr. Godwin Wonah (Primary School) and Mrs. Oyewale Monisola (Head Teacher).
The Chairman of the IUSS Board seized the moment to welcome the Vice-Chancellor to the University, while, congratulating him on his recent appointment and assumption of office. She also gave a brief history of the school and reports on the current state of affair of the school.
She however, noted that the primary challenge of the school apart from fund is erosion which is threatening the foundation of the buildings.In his response, the Vice-Chancellor thanked the Board of Management of IUSS for deeming it fit to pay him the courtesy visit. He assured them of his readiness to give support at all times, He also thanked them for the prudent management of the facilities and available meager resources of the school.
He noted that the erosion problem is geographical, based on the location of the school structures. He however assures that steps would be taken to mitigate the erosion challenge in due course, particularly as it affects the Crown Estate at large.
Afterwards, the Vice-Chancellor attended to the team from Igbinedion University Teaching Hospital. The team was led by the Chief Medical Director of the Hospital Prof. Julius Awe. Oke, other members, include CMAC of the hospital Dr. R. Uduoise, Head of Administration Barr. Omorege and the Hospital Administrator Mr. Ben Inaken.
The CMD, Prof. Julius Awe, thanked the Vice-Chancellor for honoring their request to pay him a courtesy call, and as well congratulated him on his assumption of office as new Vice-Chancellor of the great Igbinedion University.
Prof. Awe however, noted that the Teaching Hospital Board would soon pay the Vice-Chancellor a formal visit, but that this is the Hospital Management team that was visiting.
He gave a brief update on the activities of the hospital and asked the Vice-Chancellor to please find time to visit the hospital any time soon to see things for himself.
Responding, The Vice-Chancellor thanked the Hospital Management team for the courtesy visit. He assured them of his commitment to maintain the stride of the immediate past Vice-Chancellor Prof. Osaghae and to improve on it everywhere possible so that the good works may endure.
He also assured, the CMD that he would pay a working visit to the hospital to have first hand encounter with the environment.

item.title: HUAWEI Team Visits IUO
item.dc:creator: dami
item.content:encoded:
[rev_slider alias="Huawei Team Visits"]
The Vice-Chancellor Prof. Lawrence Ezemonye received a two man delegation from Huawei Technologies Nig. Ltd in his office on Friday 20<sup>th</sup> July 2018.
The Huawei Team comprised of the Channel Service Project Manager of the Company, Mr. Francis Anyaebosi and Mr. Sam Wang the Training Manager. Also in attendance were some Principal Officers of the University; the Registrar Mr. Edwin Okoro, the Bursar, Mr. Nosa Edogiaweire (FCA).
After a brief introduction of guest and members of University Management in attendance, the Channel Service Project Manager of Huawei spoke on behalf of the company. He thanked the VC for the warm reception and expressed the companys readiness to partner with the University in advancing training research and upgrading of ICT manpower and technological/infrastructures, in the University.
He particularly offered University the HUAWEI HAINA program which involves training the trainers who will in turn train others in the University. He said the program apart from being an employment catalyst to students will be a solid IGR for the University.
Mr. Anyaebosi further informed that there are incentives to the overall Best Student of each training session and that such incentive including an all expense paid trip to China plus empowerment to advance in ICT career.
He also intimated the Vice-Chancellor that the University will also benefit from the training program including monetary benefit of one thousand dollars for the University and five hundred dollars for every certified student.
In his response, the VC heartily welcomed the team. He reiterated that IUO is a University of class, Legacy trending University and a University where stars go to school. He quickly informed the HUAWEI Team of Master Awani Vincent Esimaje, a 100 Level Law Student of the University who is trending as the designer of the Nigerias Super Eagles Ceremonial attire popularly begin referred to as Aso-Ebi which won the best Ceremonial attire at the opening Ceremony of the just concluded FIFA Russia 2018 World Cup Tournament.
The Vice-Chancellor agreed with the HUAWEI Team that ICT rules the World and that every investment in the development of human capital in that direction is needed and desirable.
He therefore assured the HUAWEI Team of the Universitys readiness to partner and participate fully in all of the offers of HUAWEI. He expressed his eagerness to receive an MOU from the company which he assures will be treated with the urgency that it deserves. The meeting ended with a group photograph.

item.title: VC Tours Benin Centers
item.dc:creator: dami
item.content:encoded: The Vice-Chancellor Prof. Lawrence Ezemonye recently made a tour of the Universitys study facilities located in Benin City on Tuesday 14th July 2018 as the first and major tour of University resources since he assumed office. His first port of call was the Part-Time Study Centre on Sapele Road. The Vice-Chancellor who was accompanied by all Principal Officers of the University was taken round the facility by the Director of Part-Time program Dr. David Omobuare. The Vice-Chancellor while inspecting the classrooms and the other facilities at the centre commended the Director of the Centre for the work done so far. The Director informed the VC that the money spent to improve the centre was basically from the dues and earnings made from the Centre for Entrepreneurship of the University. The Vice-Chancellor thereafter made some suggestions on better ways to ultilize and manage the space of the centre, including running of JUPEB programme and temporarily, cordoning off a portion of the facility that are not in use to improve on the aesthetics and safety of resources at the centre. The Vice-Chancellors entourage later moved to the University Liaison Office on Airport Road to visit the Benin Film Academy situated in the building. On arrival, the Vice-Chancellors entourage was received by the Admin Officer at the Benin Film Academy Mr. Osas Earlience who took the VC and others on a guided tour of the training facilities in the Centre. The VC was shown the class room, the photography room, the costume room and offices within the building. In his interaction with the Admin Officer, the Vice-Chancellor encouraged the centre to establish linkages with institutions abroad for exchange programmes and also to prospect more avenues for outreach programs. In his response, the Admin Officer expressed regret that the Director of the centre, Mr. Lancelot Imaseun was out of the country at the moment. He assured the VC that effort are already ongoing with the British Film Academy for partnership and student exchange program. He also showed the VC banners of previous Masterclass that the Centre has held with leading Nollywood and International movie stars. The VC commended the center for their ingenuity and commitment in making a difference in the society. The visit ended with a group photograph.

item.title: Visit by Aphrikulture
item.dc:creator: dami
item.content:encoded:
[rev_slider alias="Visit by Afrikulture"]
The Vice-Chancellor has received a team of Agriculture experts from Isreal.
The team representing APHRIKULTURE comprised of Guy Gishri, Chief Business Development officer, Rami Alon Agro Culture Expert, Jonathan Spenser, Agronomist & Agro economies expert, accompanying the team were Mr. Joe Osagbebareh and Mr. Igbinosa Igbinedion.
The team lead by Mr. Guy Gishri conveyed the goodwill of the Organization, Aphrikulture, to the Vice-Chancellor on his new appointment and assumption of office. He, further highlighted the purpose of their visit which according to him was to seek partnership with Igbinedion University Okada on large Scale agriculture production, training and knowledge transfer.
Mr. Gushri informed the Vice-Chancellor that Aphrikulture is an Organisation that specialized in large scale agricultural project in the wide spectrum of agriculture ranging from Poultry to fishery, Diary, maize and other crops productions. He noted that the team is a tac team of highly skilled complimentary experts with previous local experience of the Nigerian terrain.
He, introduced Rami Alon as an aqua culture expert, with wide experience in Nigeria having lied in Nigeria for over fifteen years before leaving for Israel and is now back in Nigeria, While Mr. Spenser is highly skilled in planning and execution.
Mr. Gishri expressed the Optimism that his Organization can work with Igbinedion University and achieved a great deal.
In his response, the Vice-Chancellor thanked the team for the timely visit. He noted that the mission of Aphrikulture is directly in line with the natural policy on agriculture and expressed the readiness of the University to buy into the program.
He expressed the optimism that partnership between the University and Aphrikulture will provide opportunities for training of students and extension service in agriculture.
The Vice-Chancellor therefore, called for a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) that would enumerate the modalities of the program and highlight the interest, advantage and value chain of the process.

item.title: Anita Ukah, Alumnus of Igbinedion University, Okada emerge winner of the Most Beautiful Girl in Nigeria, MBGN, 2018
item.dc:creator: agbolade
item.content:encoded: [caption id="attachment_6821" align="alignnone" width="733"] Miss-Imo-Anita-Ukah[/caption] Miss Imo, Anita Ukah, has emerged winner of the Most Beautiful Girl in Nigeria, MBGN, 2018. She beat 36 other contestants at the Most Beautiful Girl in Nigeria contest that held on Friday at Gabriel Okara Cultural Centre, Bayelsa State. She will represent Nigeria at the Miss World 2018 in China. She will represent Nigeria at the Miss World 2018 in China. The pageant was hosted by Toke Makinwa and Ike Osakioduwa. Miss Imo fought off competitions from Miss Lagos, Miss Edo, Miss Kwara, Miss Sokoto, Miss Ogun and other contestants to become the most beautiful girl in Nigeria.

item.title: Freshers Orientation
item.dc:creator: agbolade
item.content:encoded:
https://youtu.be/xMhjrdtxBm8   Registration Instructions for 2018/2019 Academic Session Congratulations to have met our admission requirements as specified on our admission requirements page. Please follow the instructions below to register for this academic session:
  1. Login to your student portal page athttps://iuokada.edu.ng/portal/students. Your username is your application number. Password is 2016. Please ensure to change your password upon login.
  2. If you did not upload your credentials/certificates during the filling of the online application form, kindly do so by clicking on Profile after login to your portal.
  3. Upon completion of your online data, click on Print Data Page from the same profile page in step 2 above and print 4 copies of your Profile Page and bring it during the One-stop-shop registration exercise on the 29thof September, 2018. Please note that only students that have completely filled their profile online can print the Profile Data Page.
  4. Upon arrival at the One-stop-shop venue, proceed to the Bursary Unit stand to collect your Smart Receipt for the confirmation of your financial status. Also bring along with you printed copies of your etranzact payment receipts.
  5. After clearance from the Bursary Unit, proceed to the Library Unit stand for your Library clearance.
  6. Upon successful completion of your library registration, proceed to your college for college clearance.
  7. Finally, proceed to the Registry Unit for completion of your One-stop-shop registration.
We wish you a successful stay in Igbinedion University, Okada.

Congratulations to have met our admission requirements as specified on our admission requirements page.
Please follow the instructions below to register for this academic session:
1. Login to your student portal page at https://iuokada.edu.ng/portal/students. Your username is your application number. Password is 2016. Please ensure to change your password upon login. 2. If you did not upload your credentials/certificates during the filling of the online application form, kindly do so by clicking on Profile after login to your portal. 3. Upon completion of your online data, click on Print Data Page from the same profile page in step 2 above and print 4 copies of your Profile Page and bring it during the One-stop-shop registration exercise on the 29th of September, 2018. Please note that only students that have completely filled their profile online can print the Profile Data Page. 4. Upon arrival at the One-stop-shop venue, proceed to the Bursary Unit stand to collect your Smart Receipt for the confirmation of your financial status. Also bring along with you printed copies of your etranzact payment receipts. 5. After clearance from the Bursary Unit, proceed to the Library Unit stand for your Library clearance. 6. Upon successful completion of your library registration, proceed to your college for college clearance. 7. Finally, proceed to the Registry Unit for completion of your One-stop-shop registration.
We wish you a successful stay in Igbinedion University, Okada.
